alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 9:28PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Carbon and northwestern Monroe Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 928 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near White Haven, or 11 miles southeast of Wilkes-Barre, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tobyhanna, Blakeslee, Long Pond, Albrightsville, Pocono Pines, Pocono Raceway, Lake Harmony, Gouldsboro State Park and Arrowhead Lake. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 90 and 97. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 297. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 2 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
